Package w23lab4

Class YourPurchases

java.lang.Object
w23lab4.YourPurchases
public class YourPurchases extends Object
File name: YourPurchases.java Author: Wai Wai Chan, 041057469 Course: CST8284, Java Assignment: Lab 04 Due Date: 24 Feb 2023 Professor: David Houtman

Description: This class provides methods to record the purchase amount, received payment, and calculate change due for a purchase.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Wai Wai Chan

  • Constructor Details

    • YourPurchases

      public YourPurchases()
      Constructs a YourPurchases object with purchase and payment values set to 0.

  • Method Details

    • getPurchase

      public double getPurchase()
      Returns the amount of purchases. It has not been checked for valid purchase price, i.e. may return a negative purchased price.
      Returns:
      amount of purchases

    • getPayment

      public double getPayment()
      Returns the amount of payment. It has not been checked for valid payment amount, i.e. may return a negative payment amount.
      Returns:
      amount of payments

    • recordPurchase

      public void recordPurchase(double amount)
      Records the purchase price of an item. The price of the purchased item should be a floating number equal to or greater than zero, however it is not checked for valid input i.e. it may contain a negative number. Input non-numeric values will cause the program to crash.
      Parameters:
      amount - the price of the purchased item

    • receivePayment

      public void receivePayment(int dollars, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies)
      Enters the payment received from the customer. The number of the received coins should be an integer equal to or greater than zero, however it is not checked for valid input i.e. it may contain a negative number. Input non-numeric value or a floating number will cause the program to crash.
      Parameters:
      dollars - the number of dollars in the payment
      quarters - the number of quarters in the payment
      dimes - the number of dimes in the payment
      nickels - the number of nickels in the payment
      pennies - the number of pennies in the payment

    • CalculateChange

      public double CalculateChange()
      Computes and returns the change due. This is done with some errors in the calculations. Since it has not been checked for valid input of payment and purchase, it may return an invalid change value, i.e. may return a negative change value.
      Returns:
      the change due to the customer

    • giveChange

      public double giveChange()
      Computes the change due and resets the machine for the next customer. Since it has not been checked for valid input of payment and purchase, it may return an invalid change value, i.e. may return a negative change value.
      Returns:
      the change due to the customer
